subject: Marketing
title: The Boomerang Effect
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Boomerang Effect.

hook.text: A campaign to reduce teen drug use actually increased curiosity and experimentation.

buildup.text: The boomerang effect occurs when persuasion produces the exact opposite result.

discovery.text: It happens when the message is too strong, too obvious, or threatens self-image.

twist.text: Anti-piracy ads calling viewers thieves made piracy feel rebellious and cool.

climax.text: Heavy-handed messaging can create the exact behavior you're trying to prevent.

punchline.text: Push too hard and people push the other way.

quiz.question: What is the boomerang effect in marketing?
options: A persuasion attempt that produces the opposite of the intended result
An ad campaign that keeps returning higher profits each quarter
A pricing strategy that rebounds after an initial dip
